Bass.comm: Great bass performance for the price.

cont.entity_a: Offers a lot of bass. Bass is clear and room-filling without distortion.
cont.entity_b: Suitable for small rooms. Not suitable for large rooms or high volume.

Reliability.comm: Product reliability is questionable, with frequent reports of failure after warranty.

cont.entity_a: Common issues with faulty amplifiers, often requiring replacement. Frequent problems with buzzing and amplifier failure after a few years. Known issue with amplifiers being stuck in standby mode.

Sound Quality.comm: Great for both music and movies.

cont.entity_a: Fantastic sound quality with deep, accurate bass when operational. Commonly praised for sound quality and performance when functioning.
cont.entity_b: Sound quality can be inconsistent, with some electrical noise reported.

cont.entity_a: Large size, taking up significant space.
cont.entity_b: Sleek design and easy to install with RCA connections. Compact size.
Value for money is unbeatable at this price point.

cont.entity_a: Known issue with amplifiers being stuck in standby mode.
Significant improvement over previous models like the PSW10.
cont.entity_b: Pairs well with other Polk products and works well in small to medium rooms.

cont.entity_a: LFE RCA port is available for connections.
cont.entity_b: Simple setup and good for boosting lower frequencies in music and movies.

Performance.comm: Effective in enhancing both music and movie experiences.

cont.entity_a: Powerful enough to enhance home theater experiences.
cont.entity_b: Limited to certain frequency ranges, not suitable for deep bass.

cont.entity_a: Customer service experiences are mixed, with some successful warranty claims.

cont.entity_b: Known issues with port noise and distortion at low frequencies.
